title: News regarding Nexus Software
story_body:
Nexus Software Appoints New VP of Customer Success, Plans Industry Conference Participation

Nexus Software (NXS) announced today the appointment of Sandra Chen as Vice President of Customer Success, effective immediately. Chen, who previously served as Senior Director of Client Services at the company, will oversee customer retention strategies and support operations across all product lines.

"Sandra's deep understanding of our client base and proven track record in building strong customer relationships made her the natural choice for this role," said Michael Torres, Chief Operating Officer at Nexus Software. Chen has been with the company for seven years and played a key role in developing the company's customer onboarding framework.

In her new position, Chen will report directly to Torres and manage a team of approximately 50 customer success professionals across North America. The role was previously held by David Winters, who left the company in September to pursue other opportunities.

Separately, Nexus Software confirmed its participation in the upcoming TechConnect Summit scheduled for next month in Austin, Texas. The company will showcase its latest enterprise resource planning solutions at booth 412 and host two breakout sessions on digital transformation trends in mid-market businesses.

"The TechConnect Summit provides an excellent platform to engage with current and prospective clients," said Jennifer Liu, Nexus Software's Chief Marketing Officer. "We're looking forward to demonstrating how our solutions can help organizations streamline their operations."

The company also announced the launch of its "Code for Good" initiative, committing to donate 500 hours of software development expertise annually to nonprofit organizations. The program, which begins in January, will allow Nexus employees to volunteer their technical skills during work hours to help charitable organizations improve their digital infrastructure.

Three nonprofit partners have already been selected for the program's first year, including a regional food bank network and two education-focused organizations. Employees can dedicate up to 20 hours per year to the initiative.

Nexus Software, headquartered in Denver, Colorado, provides enterprise software solutions to over 2,000 businesses worldwide. The company reported revenues of $445 million in its most recent fiscal year.
